captions.text: Hey Vsauce, I'm Jake and get ready to App...ughh

Even with only one arm I can still pick up
Space Chicks. In this fun take on the endless

platformer genre, you hop from celestial body
to celestial body, rescuing dem heavenly bodies.

You have to get the damsels in distress to
their space ships all while avoiding steam

jets, alien bugs and ones that shoot explosives
at you. Gravity also plays a role as the larger

planets have more pull than one you might
be trying to land on. But let's change gears
with

GT Racing 2. Besides having really great graphics,
GT Racing 2 has 67 licensed cars and a multitude

of tracks. The single player campaign has
different kinds of races like classic, one

on one duels and knockouts. As you upgrade
your vehicle and unlock new ones, you gain

access to campaigns for that specific car.
The game features a fun multiplayer mode so

you can test your racing ability against others.
Sorry, I'm starting to sound a bit

Pretentious...Game, a short and interesting
platformer. Each level is a different line

from a poem that not only tells the story
but also gives you a clue on what to do as

you conquer various obstacles both seen and
unseen in an effort to get back to your love...your

polygonal love. Once reunited, hopefully,
you both will be in perfect

Harmony. Harmony is a puzzle game where you
have to organize the blocks by their color

creating a uniform palette. They can move
vertically or horizontally and each block

as a set number of moves it can make. There
are over 1000 levels and no time limit so

the game is pretty relaxing. But if you crave
stress, there is

Boson X. Boson X is awesome. Frustratingly
awesome. There are no power-ups or coins,

just straight up running and jumping from
platform to platform inside a particle accelerator.

You have to run on certain platforms to increase
the percentage of an experiment being completed,

and once at 100%, a new particle is discovered
which then opens up a new level. This game

is fast paced and will result in you bursting
into atoms very frequently but the difficulty

adds to how insanely fun the whole thing is.
After beating a few levels you will have found
zen...

Alpha Zen. Like Harmony, Alpha Zen is a relaxing
and go at your own pace puzzle game. You connect

words together so they fit perfectly within
the given parameters. It is kind of like a

weird version of a crossword and they combine
to form different classic quotes. But who
needs to use words when you got guns in...

Neon Shadow, a first person shooter that finds
you trying to regain control from some evil

AI that has taken over a space station. The
game is pretty straight forward, there isn't

much exploring to be had just good ol' blowing
up bad guys with a variety of weapons. It

has almost a DOOM feel to it which works really
well and FPSs on mobile can be kinda difficult

to control but luckily this one has a snap
feature that makes it easier to aim. And instead
of controlling the gun, take control of the

Deadly Bullet. I'm going to summarize this
game in one sentence: You are a bullet that

flies around a city blowing through power-ups,
crates and people. The end. It's great. However,

if guns and bullets aren't your thing, try
Magic...2014

Back when I was a young lad I played the physical
Magic the Gathering card game a lot, ladies,

and now that it is on your tablet, it makes
everything much easier since your card deck

is no longer physical. The cost of entry is
zero dollars so if you have never played Magic

before, you can do so with no risk and the
intro levels are actually great at getting

you into the game. Snd, of course, a multiplayer
mode so you can play against friends and other

players around the world. Just be sure to
seal your cards up to keep from getting wet
in this episodes app of the week...
Assassin's Creed: Pirates.

Assassin's Creed: Pirates, as the name suggests,
finds you as a pirate sailing the high seas

on a quest for treasures, better ships and
intense naval battles. In each level there

are multiple side missions to complete as
you progress through the game like assassination

missions, races, and treasure hunts. Sailing
around and exploring the locations is incredibly

fun, but not as fun as the awesome cannon
volleys you will have with enemy vessels.

It becomes a back and forth of dodging and
firing as you try to sink their ship and acquire

their riches. You can upgrade your ship, hire
more crew that then give you more perks, and

get your hands on bigger boats, all in an
effort to rule the seas.

Links to all the apps can be found in the
description below.
I'm Jake and, as always, thanks for watching.
